properties.name: Ai Marmi
properties.description: Posted by Maxpower pay a visit to Ai Marmi , so popular that the tables are always full and on weekends, there\'s a crowd waiting to get in. The pizzas are cheap and good. After a long night at the pubs, you cannot miss this place! The margeritas are the gooiest pizzas in the city. And the fritti are freshly made and never greasy. Try the fried stuffed zucchini blossoms. The place has been affectionately nicknamed the "l\'obitorio " (the morgue), for its unadorned white marble tables, which stretch out onto the sidewalk in summer. € Viale di Trastevere 53 tel. 06.5800919 Closed Tuesdays and at lunch. Open late.

properties.name: Beachside restaurant
properties.description: Posted by Maxpower This is a great beach side place to get a meal. It\'s family run and I\'m pretty sure the mama makes all the food along with her daughters.

properties.name: Pizza Boom
properties.description: Posted by MaxpowerThis was my favorite pizza place in all of Roma when i studied there. The owner Alberto is the man. They also have great roasted chicken with potatoes.

properties.name: Q Bar-Allegedly spit on the bouncer
properties.description: Posted by Lpv99dublin, irelandBar in Temple Bar district of Dublin, Ireland. I was told it\'s owned by Bono

properties.name: Reservoir
properties.description: Posted by Gruntingfrog 9 avenue deluth e, montreal, qc, caA brasserie with beer brewed onsite.

properties.name: San Francisco Brewing Company
properties.description: Posted by GarlynnThe San Francisco Brewing Company is located in what may be the last remaining saloon building from the Barbary Coast era. This place exudes history, in a sort of old-west-charm kind of way. Their beer rotates frequently, but is generally quite good. The happy hours are a good time to drop in and sample their selection.

properties.name: Schwartz's World Famous Smoke Meat
properties.description: Posted by Lydiag 3895 St. Laurent, H2W 1X9, Montreal, CanadaNot to be missed! Order their famous smoked meat sandwich on rye (with pickle on the side). Worth the wait (always a line out the door!)

properties.name: St Laurent Boulevard nightlife
properties.description: Posted by Lydiag  St Laurent Boulevard, Montreal CanadaGreat street (north of Sherbrooke) to hang out on in the evening, with lots of bars, restaurants and clubs. See link for details

properties.name: The Anchor Guesthouse
properties.description: Posted by Chasb73Nice B&B to stay in if your in Dublin

properties.name: The Brewer's Art
properties.description: Posted by Nabaclish 1106 N. Charles Street, Baltimore, MDDidn\'t get a chance to go in (they were closed), but I did have a chance to taste their Resurrection Ale in a nearby pub that they sell their beers through. Brewer\'s Art specializes in Belgian style beers, and I urge you to check them out, or try their beers in any way you can!

properties.name: Verres Sterilises
properties.description: Posted by Gruntingfrog 800 rue rachel e, montreal, qc, caDive bar that serves local microbrews and Czech beer on tap.
